keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The pantries have sprung up across the country to help people who view their pets as family, and spend their last dollars on a can of Purina.

headline.print_headline: No Longer Picking Whether They Eat Or Their Pets Do
headline.main: Pet Food Pantries Offer Relief to Animal Owners Struggling With Bills

snippet: The pantries have sprung up across the country to help people who view their pets as family, and spend their last dollars on a can of Purina.
abstract: Pet food pantry opened by Animal Care Centers of NYC in Bronx has given out over 2,000 pounds of pet food to low-income owners in first five months of operation; pantry is part of national push by animal welfare organizations to reduce population in animal shelters by assisting poor pet owners before they resort to giving up their animals; critics have questioned whether it is appropriate use of resources.
